meanings.definition: To provide a group of people to operate or work on (a ship, aircraft, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The captain crewed the ship with skilled sailors.
meanings.sent2: The astronauts crewed the spacecraft for their mission.
meanings.sent3: The penguins crewed the iceberg, making sure it stayed afloat.
meanings.sent4: The team crewed the project, ensuring it sailed smoothly to completion.
meanings.sent5: The workers crewed the factory, keeping it running efficiently.

meanings.definition: To be a member of a crew.
meanings.sent1: She crewed on the fishing boat during the summer.
meanings.sent2: He crewed on the racing yacht for the championship.
meanings.sent3: The cat crewed on the pirate ship, catching mice for the crew.
meanings.sent4: The students crewed on the school play, helping with props and costumes.
meanings.sent5: They crewed on the space shuttle, assisting the astronauts during the mission.
